page.title: 07RECREATION IN BISLEY
page.content: There are many clubs and societies operating the the village which enjoy the support of different sections of the population. The main venue for these groups is the W.I. Hall,a wooden building in the centre of the village. The Tuesday Club, a group of senior citizens meets once a week for a variety of activities. The Womens' Institute is a very well supported and central group to many other activities in the village like the Christmas Panomime which has both male and female actors. For the young there is a youth club, Guides, Brownies and Red Cross. A cricket club plays against other villages on the playing field in the summer. A group of enthusiastic bellringers keep the church bells going. The church has a small choir. A theatre visiting group go to plays at Bath and Stratford.
